TripEvents.Name: Private transfer Oslo Gardermoen Airport to City

Description.ShortItineraryNote: Transfers include one suitcase and one carry on per person. Any additional luggage must be pre-booked.
Description.ItineraryNote: Bislet Limousineservice Emergency number: + 47 900 29 085Your driver will meet you holding a name sign.

Description.InfoNote: This historical hotel enjoys a central position between Aker Brygge, the Royal Palace, Nationaltheatret and Norway’s parliament, the Storting. Each of the 155 rooms and suites has its own unique character, with decor, soft furnishings and art all hand-selected and juxtaposed with the greatest of care. Hotel Continental gives its guests plenty to feast their eyes on, whilst preserving the quality, attention to detail and the cosmopolitan atmosphere that have always been Hotel Continental’s trademarks.
Description.ShortItineraryNote: The spacious Superior Rooms are 24sqm and have king-size beds or twin beds. Room amenities include 1 x king-size bed (180 x 200 cm) or 2 x twin beds (90 x 200 cm), LED flat-screen and movies on demand, AppleTV and Chromecast, Nespresso coffee machine, minibar with a good selection of drinks and snacks, safe, iron and ironing board.The private bathroom has a bathtub or shower, bathrobes, slippers, hairdryer and Molton Brown toiletries. Free entry to the fitness facilities and free internet access are included.

Discover the must-sees of beautiful Oslo including the Royal Palace and Vigeland Park  on a private walking tour.Enjoy all the landmarks of Oslo's city centre on a private 3-hour walking tour with a local guide. Get a taste of the life in this vibrant capital through its famous sights, and enjoy its architectural and cultural diversity. See the Royal Palace, the Norwegian Parliament, and the University of Oslo, and stroll the bustling Karl Johan pedestrian shopping area. Take the tram to the iconic Vigeland Park and explore the incredible and unique works of sculptor Gustav Vigeland. A perfect introduction to the Norwegian capital! Duration: 3 hours Inclusions: Private English speaking guide, visit to Vigeland Park, public transportationExclusions: Food and drinkActivity Level: ModerateAccessible: Yes
Description.ItineraryNote: Your guide, tel +47 95094363, will meet you in hotel reception. Please be ready in good time. ​

Description.ServiceNote: ​Some of our favourite restaurants in Oslo:Engebret Cafe: Charming historic restaurant with great foodStatholdergaarden: table reservations is needed, but they also offer a more informal Food & Wine cellar.Maaemo: Michelin star restaurant in Oslo. Ekeberg Restaurant: lovely location with views of Oslo - also great for lunch combined with a walk in the Ekeberg Sculpture Park Castello: located on the waterfront at Sørenga near the Opera and Munch Museum. Sommerro has a great rooftop restaurant TAK (roof). You can find all on-site restaurant in this link. Breakfast is served in the Ekspedisjonshallen. Rest: The name means “leftovers” and Chef Jimmy Øien and his team are working towards a zero-waste philosophy that also involves using ingredients that no one else wants and turn it into a beautiful high-class manu. Kontrast: Swedish chef Mikael Svensson is cooking New Nordic food his own way and that has earned the restaurant a Michelin star three years in a row. Smalhans: a neighbourhood restaurant open from lunch to dinner and the only restaurant in Norway with a Bib Gourmand rating in the Michelin guide. Sentralen: Norwegian brasserie-style food: simple and modern and using local ingredient, also home of Hitchhiker Restaurant and the rooftop terrace Mynt. Two great international options: Ling Ling Oslo, a Cantonese restaurant with a rooftop terrace and Plah, a modern Thai cuisine & airy, upscale bar for street food, plus leafy terrace.For more suggestions, please see our attractions page: https://www.fiftydegreesnorth.com/eu/attractions/restaurant-options-in-oslo
Description.ShortItineraryNote: Enjoy your day at leisure in Oslo. Visit highlights such as the Natural History Museum, Akershus Fortress, The Norwegian National Opera & ballet or the Fram Museum.

TripEvents.Name: Day trip to Hadeland Glassworks & Kistefos Museum

Description.ShortItineraryNote: Enjoy a private guided day trip to Hadeland Glassworks & Kistefos Museum.In scenic surroundings one hour from Oslo you find Hadeland Glassworks, a tourist attraction and shopping destination founded on history, art, culture and handicraft traditions. The glassworks were founded in 1762 and is the oldest industrial company in Norway with continuous operation. The glass museum is the largest in Scandinavia, and displays Hadeland creations from the last 250 years. Enjoy lunch in one of the charming cafes or restaurant at Hadeland (payable locally). After the visit the tour continues to the amazing Kistefos Museum, Northern Europe`s largest sculpture park for contemporary art. Famous architecture alongside historical industry and art exhibitions, set in a stunning sculpture park. Driving time one way from Oslo: 1.5 hoursTotal duration including transfer: Ca 6 hours totalInclusions: Guide, entry to Hadeland Glassworks and Kistefoss Museum  Not included: Lunch (paid locally), private guided tour of the exhibition in The Twist at the Kistefoss Museum is an additional cost and must be pre booked.
Description.ItineraryNote: ​Your guide, tel +47 95094363, will meet you in hotel reception. Please be ready in good time. ​

TripEvents.Name: Car & driver for Hadeland & Kistefoss daytrip

TripEvents.Name: Rail Journey from Oslo to Flåm including Flåmsbana

Description.ServiceNote: ​Your hotel can assist you in arranging transportation. https://maps.app.goo.gl/mYjWSgkTg3FeYbF8A
Description.ShortItineraryNote: The train journey from Oslo to Flåm takes you over the Hardangervidda plateau to the small station of Myrdal, from where you will continue with the world-renown Flåmsbana, i.e. the Flåm Railway all the way to Flåm. In the span of a brief hour, the train takes you from sea level at the Sognefjord in Flåm to the Myrdal mountain station at 867 metres above sea level. The Flåm Railway is one of the steepest standard-gauge railway lines in the world, with 80% of the journey at a gradient of 5.5%. The train runs through spectacular scenery, alongside the Rallar Road, vertiginous mountainsides, foaming waterfalls, through 20 tunnels and offers so many viewpoints that, for many people, a single trip up and down is not enough. National Geographic Traveler Magazine calls the Flåm Railway one of the top 10 train journeys in Europe while in 2014 Lonely Planet Traveller went even further, and named it the best train journeys in the world.
Description.ItineraryNote: Please find your tickets with the travel documents. On board the train, please present the ticket on your mobile phone or as a printed copy.Seats on the train have been automatically assigned by VY and seating map is not available.NOTE: We recommend getting a lunch pack from your hotel or buying something at the station to bring with you on the train. The restaurant carriage onboard have a small selection of food, good tea and coffee.

TripEvents.Name: Go High in Aurland - 3 nights: Activities & Transfers

Description.InfoNote: Nestled in the heart of Aurland, 29/2 Aurland Hotel is a charming retreat amidst Norway's majestic fjords. With its picturesque location, this family owned boutique hotel offers a cozy haven for travellers seeking tranquility and natural beauty. The hotel features a variety of accommodations, each uniquely decorated and designed to provide comfort and relaxation.Guests can unwind in the inviting communal areas, such as the lounge with a crackling fireplace, or step outside to soak in the stunning mountain vistas. Whether enjoying a homemade breakfast made from local ingredients or embarking on outdoor adventures in the surrounding wilderness, 29/2 Aurland Hotel provides an unforgettable stay immersed in the breathtaking landscapes of Norway.
Description.ShortItineraryNote: 29/2 Aurland is a boutique hotel in the heart of the Norwegian fjords, perfectly located near Flam. The hotel’s décor is unique with old and traditional colours, recycled materials, antiques and new design furniture. Guests can relax in the communal lounge, spend time in the beautiful gardens or relax in the wood-fired hot tub.A homemade breakfast is served each morning. Itinerary for 3 people:24SEP:  Arrive with your private transfer to the lodge. Enjoy a bowl of hot soup with fresh bread or quiche and fresh apple juice at ETE Restaurant which is a converted Smokehouse.To top it up and to get you ready for the hiking adventure, enjoy a homemade dessert.  After dessert, we head off on a lovely waterfall hike, alongside the Turlid Waterfall to Stegastein Viewpoint. Your guide will give you an introduction to the area, its history and folklore. During the hike, enjoy a cup of warm coffee or tea and a cinnamon roll while admiring the view. Remember your camera, because this is one you will want to remember. After the hike, relax in the calm and quiet garden before dinner is served at the cosy lodge. 25SEP:  The day starts out with a breakfast of champions, giving you a taste of the magic that is local, organic ingredients. After breakfast, set out on Stegastein viewpoint visit and hike to Prest. This is a half day activity (4hrs). Full day activity on request.26SEP:   Today you will visit to a traditional pasture farm high up in the mountains with fantastic views. On summer farms, Norwegians have been spending their summers producing cheese and taking care of livestock for generations. The tradition continues through hard-working farmers and their love for natural and ecological produce. On the summer farm, enjoy lunch in rustic surroundings, whilst enjoying the fantastic view. After the adventure, we head back down to the lodge. Enjoy the garden before sitting down to dinner at ETE Restaurant.   27SEP:  Before you leave, enjoy your last breakfast at 29|2 Aurland, remember to breathe in the fresh air. If your departure is later in the afternoon, choose an activity fromthe optional activities menu.Included:•  Private return transfer between Flåm and Aurland•  3 x lunches•  Waterfall hike and Stegastein drive•  2 x hiking (level of difficulty based on your preferences)•  Hot tub Please note that no drinks/alcohol is included.Activity level: 3 (suitable for experienced hikers with a high level of fitness) * The hot tub is guaranteed but could be available on a different day due to high demand.
Description.ItineraryNote: ​If your tour includes a pick up from Flåm Railway Station or Ferry pier, your driver will meet you with a name sign at the end of the platform.Good to know: 29I2 Aurland does not have a full bar. Wine, Beer and Gin are available for purchase.
Description.OptionContent: Active package, ADD ACCOMMODATION, Activity level 3

Description.InfoNote: Nestled in the heart of Aurland, 29/2 Aurland Hotel is a charming retreat amidst Norway's majestic fjords. With its picturesque location, this family owned boutique hotel offers a cozy haven for travellers seeking tranquility and natural beauty. The hotel features a variety of accommodations, each uniquely decorated and designed to provide comfort and relaxation.Guests can unwind in the inviting communal areas, such as the lounge with a crackling fireplace, or step outside to soak in the stunning mountain vistas. Whether enjoying a homemade breakfast made from local ingredients or embarking on outdoor adventures in the surrounding wilderness, 29/2 Aurland Hotel provides an unforgettable stay immersed in the breathtaking landscapes of Norway.
Description.ShortItineraryNote: 29/2 Aurland is a boutique hotel in the heart of the Norwegian fjords, perfectly located near Flam. The hotel’s décor is unique with old and traditional colours, recycled materials, antiques and new design furniture. Guests can relax in the communal lounge, spend time in the beautiful gardens or relax in the wood-fired hot tub.A homemade breakfast is served each morning. Itinerary for 1 adult24SEP:  Welcome to 292 Aurland. Enjoy a bowl of hot soup with fresh bread or quiche and fresh apple juice at ETE Restaurant which is a converted Smokehouse. To top it off and to get you ready for the awaiting adventure, enjoy a homemade dessert. After dessert, head off on a lovely, low-key hike through the organic fields towards Turlid Waterfall while listening to local myths related by your guide. By the waterfall, enjoy a cup of warm coffee or tea and a cinnamon roll while taking in the view. After the hike, relax in the calm and quiet garden before dinner is served at the cosy lodge. 25SEP:  A full day relaxing at the lodge. In the evening time to relax in the wood-fired hot tub (we can guarantee the hot tub experience, but due to high demand the day it is available can change between the 1st and 2nd day).Sit back, relax and enjoy your surroundings with a glass of local drink before sitting down at ETE Restaurant for dinner.26SEP:  Transfer to and from Aurland village.27SEP:  Before you leave, enjoy your last breakfast at 29|2 Aurland, remember to breathe in the fresh air. If your departure is later in the afternoon, choose an activity from our optional activities menu. Included:•  Private return transfer between Flåm and Aurland (15 mins 1-way)•  3 x lunches•  Waterfall hike, Stegastein, Borgund Stave Church •  Full day of activity to pasture farm, and stroll among the handcrafters in Aurland•  Hot tub Please note that no drinks/alcohol is included. Actvity level: 2 (moderate level of fitness required. There is a walk up a steep hill to access the pasture farm)
Description.ItineraryNote: ​If your tour includes a pick up from Flåm Railway Station or Ferry pier, your driver will meet you with a name sign at the end of the platform.Good to know: 29I2 Aurland does not have a full bar. Wine, Beer and Gin are available for purchase.
Description.OptionContent: Cultural package, ADD ACCOMMODATION, activity level 2

Description.ShortItineraryNote: ​Embark the fjord cruise in Aurland and enjoy its journey sailing through the idyllic Aurlandsfjord, which is also inscribed on the UNESCO World Heritage List. Furthermore, the boat continues through the narrow Nærøyfjord before arriving Gudvangen, innermost in the Nærøyfjord. The trip takes around two hours one way.
Description.ItineraryNote: ​Please find your voucher with the travel documents. Please be ready at the pier in good time before departure. ​
Description.OptionContent: Book in Citybreak / Premium Vessel suppl. summer only

TripEvents.Name: Superior room including breakfast
LocationCode: Approximate distance to/from Bergen Railway Station:

Description.InfoNote: Opus XVI offers you 65 unique and luxurious rooms in the very heart of Bergen. Bryggen, the popular Fish Market and the Fløyen funicular are all nearby.The hotel is housed in a historic building dating from 1876, originally designed and built for Bergen’s largest bank. Each room is individually designed with classic yet modern interiors. Enjoy the view towards Mount Fløyen or stay in a room overlooking the quiet plaza of Vågsallmenningen.
Description.ShortItineraryNote: All Superior rooms are individually furnished and have dedicated seating areas and work desks. Superior rooms provide everything you need for a pleasant and comfortable stay. Rooms have in-room Nespresso coffee machine and tea making facilities, TV with Chromecast, free Wifi and tablet for personal use. Bathroom is equipped with Molton Brown toiletries, walk-in shower and heated floors.

Description.ServiceRemarks: Guide for this tour will be Lise, mobile +4741617906
Description.ServiceNote: ​Guide for this tour will be Lise, mobile +4741617906
Description.ShortItineraryNote: Discover the sights of historic Bergen and enjoy a ride on the funicular to Mt. Fløien from where you can admire the panoramic views of the town from 1050 feet above sea level.Bergen's centre is very compact, with much to see and hear about within a very short walking distance. Stroll around Bryggen, a World Heritage Site, where you will hear of life in times gone by. Hear about life in this area from the founding of Bergen in 1070, through the Middle Ages and World War 2 to the present day. Learn about dried cod fish, Hanseatic merchants, fires, Norwegian resistance fighters and present-day life at the wharf. Pass by the lively waterside Fish Market and explore the Bergen Fortress area, where you will find Håkons Hall from 1261 and the Rosenkrantz Tower from 1560s, or wander down the old cobblestone alleyways in the heart of Bergen and see typical, quaint Bergen houses and chimney houses while hearing about life in Bergen past and present.Then take a short ride on the funicular railway up Mt Fløien. Enjoy great views, weather permitting, from the funicular and at the summit where you can also find a cafe and cashmere goats in summer. Duration: 3 hoursMeeting point: At your hotel lobby Inclusions: English speaking guide, entry to funicularActivity Level: Light-ModerateAccessible: Yes though some areas have cobblestones
Description.ItineraryNote: Your guide will meet you at your hotel in the reception area. Please be ready 10 minutes before the scheduled tour start time

Description.ServiceNote: ​Some of our favourite restaurants in Bergen:BARE - Michelin Star, local, organic, western Norway foodEnhjørningen - Fish and seafood restaurant. Pre booking recommendedCornelius - Fish and seafood restaurant on an island in the fjord. Pre booking recommended, as you transfer with boat to the islandFrescohallen - part of spectacular historical building of Bergen Børs Hotel. Local and fresh, with focus on seafood, grill and signature dishes based on sharing. Enjoy dining while listening to DJ sets that create a relaxed and fun atmosphere
Description.ShortItineraryNote: Bergen, the old Hanseatic capital on the west coast of Norway is a delight, and famous for its history as a trading town and fishing community. Surrounded by seven mountains, Bergen is ideal for enjoying the beauties of nature. A few minutes’ ride on the Fløibanen funicular will take you to the top of Mt. Fløyen, while a cable car takes you to the summit of Mt. Ulriken.Sample the delicacies on offer at the Fish Market, or spend hours among the fish, penguins and seals at Bergen Aquarium. Bergen’s old Hanseatic wharf Bryggen, is on the UNESCO's World Heritage List. Explore the wonderful wooden houses and alleyways between the storefronts and get a feel of what Bergen must have been like in the middle ages.

A lovely fjordcruise from Bergen / Os to Rosendal across the fjords south of Bergen to the Hardangerfjord – the queen of the fjords. The boat is the fastest and most comfortable means of transport between Bergen and Rosendal, also stopping at Flesland airport (buy tickets from Bergen, they are also valid from Flesland harbor). The tickets include a nice experience, lovely food and scenery ready to take your breath away.Included:•  Fjordcruise to/from Bergen – Rosendal included an 3 1/2 hour stop in Rosendal.•  Guided tour at the Manor from 1665•  Delicious 2-course hot lunch and coffee/tea with fresh ingredients from the kitchen and herb garden in Rosendal Gardens Café included!•  Exploring the romantic Rosendal Gardens with an abundance of rosesMonday – Friday guided tour at 12.00, lunch at 13.00Saturday and Sunday: lunch at 14.00 and guided tour at 15.00Lunch menu: A variety of local salmon, baked potatoes and fresh salad from our garden. Rhubarb cake with rhubarb from our garden and coffee/tea. (Alternative menu: local sausage instead of salmon, please let the waiter know).
